title: [Large-Scale] Integrated vs. Separated Teaching Method Design Workshop for Social Studies Teachers' Knowledge Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theory concepts, general understanding of social studies curricula (history, geography, economics, etc.), and foundational social studies pedagogy
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment utilizing learners' personal BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) for online and offline integration. Emphasis on real-time feedback through formative assessment in the social studies education context (cultivating citizenship, multicultural understanding, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners explain theoretical differences between integrated and separated teaching methods in social studies (e.g., integration of culture, history, geography) with 80%+ accuracy.

Using video-based assessment tools, learners analyze and propose improvements for social studies PCK (Pedagogical Content Knowledge) application cases (e.g., contextualizing historical events geographically).

Learners create a portfolio comparing and evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of two teaching methods for enhancing social studies CK (Content Knowledge) and PCK (e.g., educational contextuality, citizenship development effects).

resources: Biology Curriculum Materials (Skin & Sensory Organs Theme)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
